items.title: Epilogue: Signs
items.content:encoded:
“Hi, Julie.”

This series is a companion to Julie Yip-Williams’ posthumous memoir, The Unwinding of the Miracle, published by Random House.

Artwork by Dadu Shin.

If Julie’s story resonates with you, leave us a voicemail at (802) 347-3879.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: 3: The Unwinding of the Miracle
items.content:encoded:
“Don’t worry though, I’ll be haunting all of you.”

Julie says goodbye.

This series is a companion to Julie Yip-Williams’ posthumous memoir, The Unwinding of the Miracle, published by Random House.

Artwork by Dadu Shin.

If Julie’s story resonates with you, leave us a voicemail at (802) 347-3879.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: 2: The Secret
items.content:encoded:
"I knew in my soul that it happened to me."

Julie learns a family secret.

This series is a companion to Julie Yip-Williams’ posthumous memoir, The Unwinding of the Miracle, published by Random House.

Artwork by Dadu Shin.

If Julie’s story resonates with you, leave us a voicemail at (802) 347-3879.

items.title: Introducing Julie
items.content:encoded:
"I couldn't watch myself be born, but I can watch myself die."

Julie: The Unwinding of the Miracle begins on January 25th.

This series is a companion to her posthumous memoir, The Unwinding of the Miracle, published by Random House.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

image.title: Julie: The Unwinding of the Miracle

title: Julie: The Unwinding of the Miracle
description: Julie Yip-Williams tried to stay as present and honest as possible as she watched herself die from Stage IV colon cancer. The series chronicles her process of preparing for her death and revisiting the events of her extraordinary life, through hours of intensely personal and revealing conversations. It is an immigrant story, a love story, and a ghost story. This series is a companion to her posthumous memoir, The Unwinding of the Miracle, published by Random House on Feb 5th.
